## Public Member Functions

### convertToErrorCode() {#a1f0aa36c103f3d3d797d0d84f823a685}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::error&#95;code llvm::CGDataError::convertToErrorCode () const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Convert this error to a std::error&#95;code.

This is a temporary crutch to enable interaction with code still using std::error&#95;code. It will be removed in the future.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/cgdata/codegendata-h/#l00077">77</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/cgdata/codegendata-h">CodeGenData.h</a>.

## Public Static Functions

### take() {#a5c1e5162b968214399728c53bd61c826}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static std::pair&lt; cgdata&#95;error, std::string &gt; llvm::CGDataError::take (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> E)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
Consume an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> and return the raw enum value contained within it, and the optional error message.

The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> must either be a success value, or contain a single <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cgdataerror">CGDataError</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/cgdata/codegendata-h/#l00087">87</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/cgdata/codegendata-h">CodeGenData.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
